poemContent: For the first day my eyes bisected every inch of your personage, I gave you my energy, my all, my heart my blood, my toil, my gall. Yet, it never returned, no, your etheral glow, shut out by a blizzard of snow, my body dropping, as my mind freezes, my fingers numbing an epiphany. I pull AKs; now you run, bullets ripping through you, love, you didn't give me shit, It's no mistake. Two weeks later, I spit, on your grave.     
